channel.title: 1 question
channel.description:
I am currently working on cleaning out a delta server base and I just wanted to know things for future reference.
1: How can I make it so a item can only be used by a certain username.

item.title: 1 question
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“Dell, post:10, topic:304168”][quote author=Adam link=topic=400392.msg2969376#msg2969376 date=1253843324]
If you were to do it that way ^ then you would want this format:

if (playerName.equals("name")) { if (equipItemMethod == ####) { } }

EDIT:
That way you could use multiple statements within that one player’s name, instead of repeatedly saying:

if (playerName.equals("name")) if (playerName.equals("name")) if (playerName.equals("name")) if (playerName.equals("name"))
[/quote]

LMFAO @ EQUIPITEMMETHOD ![/quote]
I’m sorry? I don’t troll around on MoparScape creating Private Servers anymore. I’m sorry I can’t remember a method name for you. I wasn’t saying that was the method name. L2Interpret. I have better things to do with my time.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 question
item.dc:creator: @BlazezFire BlazezFire
item.description:
@BlazezFire wrote:

if(wearID == 6587 && (playerName.equals(“Sir Lethal”))) {
return false;
}

No errors but when i try to wield the weapon on another acc not called sir lethal it still wears the item.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 question

item.description:
@BlazezFire wrote:

Thanks,I combined them and only have about 3 errors[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 24, 2009, 08:07:37 pm[/size][hr]Only 1 error now.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 24, 2009, 08:09:43 pm[/size][hr]No more errors :).

Thank for not exactly giving it to me.
Now it helped me learn a bit more

i just told u ur caseing 2 different methods , you have to combine them, but you have the idea

item.title: 1 question
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:6, topic:304168”]If you were to do it that way ^ then you would want this format:

if (playerName.equals("name")) { switch(ItemID) { case ####: // Do This break; default: System.out.println("I don't know"); break; } }[/quote]

do you have any idea how many items have already cases (specs,wears etc.), you would orphan the case, and would give errors to which ever item you are choosing to specify

If you were to do it that way ^ then you would want this format:

if (playerName.equals("name")) { if (equipItemMethod == ####) { } }

EDIT:
That way you could use multiple statements within that one player’s name, instead of repeatedly saying:

if (playerName.equals("name")) if (playerName.equals("name")) if (playerName.equals("name")) if (playerName.equals("name"))

item.title: 1 question
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Dell, post:4, topic:304168”][quote author=Adam link=topic=400392.msg2969368#msg2969368 date=1253843032]
@Dell:

You would essentially want the ItemID to be first in the statement, it would just make more sense in this situation. Also, playerName returns a String, therefore BlazezFire would need to be quoted (""). Moreover, when looking to see if more than one statement is correct, you would use double && symbols. Finally, ItemIdEquals should be something like ItemID.equals; however, I’m not sure you even need the .equals argument since .equals refers to a String.
[/quote]
it would make more sense to add the name first so that you can just add on other items that player can wear , instead of making more voids it would just be a waste of space .[/quote]

Read full topic

You would essentially want the ItemID to be first in the statement, it would just make more sense in this situation. Also, playerName returns a String, therefore BlazezFire would need to be quoted (""). Moreover, when looking to see if more than one statement is correct, you would use double && symbols. Finally, ItemIdEquals should be something like ItemID.equals; however, I’m not sure you even need the .equals argument since .equals refers to a String.[/quote]
it would make more sense to add the name first so that you can just add on other items that player can wear , instead of making more voids it would just be a waste of space , and i wasnt trying to spoon feed him the code, i was just picking stuff from the top of my head .

@Mod_Adam wrote:

@Dell:

You would essentially want the ItemID to be first in the statement, it would just make more sense in this situation. Also, playerName returns a String, therefore BlazezFire would need to be quoted (""). Moreover, when looking to see if more than one statement is correct, you would use double && symbols. Finally, ItemIdEquals should be something like ItemID.equals; however, I’m not sure you even need the .equals argument since .equals refers to a String.
